Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Full-time

Description

Dream job for writers and photographers?

"Get Paid For Writing Articles That Help Millions Of People Improve Their iPhone Photography!"

  • If you want to combine your passion for writing and photography...
  • If you want to help millions of people take better iPhone photos...
  • And if you want a stable, competitive salary you can count on...

Then you don't want to miss this opportunity!

iPhonePhotographySchool.com is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. This website is visited by 1,351,004 readers every month, and we’re looking to grow it further.

Publishing excellent photography articles is an essential part of our strategy. That’s why we’re looking for an experienced writer who can explain photography techniques to our readers.

This is a permanent full-time position, and you can work from anywhere in the world.

5 Reasons To Become A Writer For iPhone Photography School

1. Combine Your Passion For Photography And Writing

You love photography. You're always learning about different aspects of photography to improve your own photos. And you find yourself sharing what you've learned to help others get better too.

You also love writing. You've done it professionally for years, and you enjoy every aspect of it.

There aren’t many jobs that combine these two passions, but you've finally found one.

Join our company and write about a subject you truly care about – photography.

2. Help Millions Of People Take Better Photos

Helping others is one of the most rewarding things you can do in life.

Wouldn’t it be great if you could help your fellow photographers just by doing your job?

Join our company, and your work will directly benefit millions of people. You’ll help your readers take stunning iPhone photos, and they’ll be able to preserve their most cherished memories!

3. Reach A Massive Audience

Thanks to blogs and social media, more content is released today than ever before.

But only a tiny portion of that content will ever get a significant readership. Flawlessly written articles rarely gain traction, while other seemingly inferior articles are often read by millions.

How can you explain this paradox? And how can you get your work in front of other people?

Join our company, and you’ll learn proven techniques for reaching a massive audience.

4. Stable Income You Can Count On

While freelance writing can be profitable, your income as a freelancer can fluctuate wildly.

The workload is never stable. Profitable months are followed by periods of low activity. And if you’re like most writers, you’d rather spend your time writing than looking for new clients.

Join our company, and you’ll get a competitive salary you can count on.

5. A Company You Actually Believe In

We’re one of the world’s most successful photography training companies.

We aim for excellence in everything we do, and we keep track of customer satisfaction for all of our products. In fact, our customer satisfaction scores are on par with companies like Apple.

Join our company, and you’ll never have to use your skills to promote low-quality products.

Here’s What We Expect Of You

  • You have a strong technical understanding of photography
  • You can explain complex technical concepts in simple terms
  • You’re a native English speaker with a passion for writing
  • You can write polished articles that don't need editing
  • You have excellent attention to detail

Please only apply if you meet all these criteria. Other applications will not be considered.

CLICK HERE TO APPLY

If you delay submitting your application, someone else will be hired before you.

items.title: Managing Editor
items.content:
Managing Editor at World Words

Remote | Freelance | International | Part-time
  • HOURS: 12 HOURS PER WEEK
  • RATE: £240 PER WEEK
  • LOCATION: REMOTE

Are you a talented and experienced content editor with a love of global travel? Do you have experience of working directly with clients? Can you manage a team of remote travel content writers, proofreading and editing their work, including feature articles, blog posts, guides, web copy and press releases? Would you relish the security of a fixed monthly retainer while enjoying the flexibility of working part-time to your own schedule and in your own home?

This could be the job for you.

The expert travel content writing agency World Words is looking for an experienced, highly skilled and flexible managing editor to head up our travel content team. You’ll work remotely in the place of your choosing and will report directly to our editor-in-chief. You will be on a retainer of a minimum of 12 hours per week, with the flexibility to increase this as needed.

As a managing editor, you will:

  • Liaise with clients at all stages of the process – from ascertaining their travel content requirements to negotiating a rate to delivering our completed content and invoicing.
  • Write some content for clients yourself and commission our pool of writers for others.
  • Edit the content delivered by writers and provide detailed editorial feedback.
  • Manage the World Words blog and social media.
  • Contribute to marketing and promotional efforts on behalf of World Words.

This role requires you to:

  • Be a first-class copy editor with a background in print and online travel content.
  • Have a proven track record of generating original and exciting travel content in a variety of different forms, from feature articles to travel guides to website copy.
  • Display perfect spelling and grammar, with meticulous proof-reading skills.
  • Have a keen understanding of variations between British and US English, and an ability to write and edit in both forms.
  • Complete your work to tight time frames, and never ever miss a deadline.
  • Display an understanding of SEO, social media marketing, CMS and HTML.
  • Show a genuine passion for travel and culture and have extensive personal travel experience (extra points for experience living abroad).

Here’s an outline of the terms:

  • Retainer of £240 per week payable for flexible availability to a maximum of 12 hours.
  • Availability for additional hours required.
  • This will vary according to workflow, where it exceeds 12 hours in any given week, the additional hours will be paid at £20 per hour.
  • The hours can be managed around your schedule, but you must be on email all day Monday to Friday and able to deal with any urgent client/writer queries that come in.
  • Candidates must be available to work from 5th August 2019. There will be an initial one month trial period, after which there will be a rolling six-monthly contract.

This is a freelance contract, so you will be responsible for your own tax return etc.

Apply for job

Job description

Stack Overflow is the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers. More than 50 million professional and aspiring programmers visit Stack Overflow each month to help solve coding problems, develop new skills, and find job opportunities.

Our products and services are focused on developer marketing, technical recruiting, market research, and private Q&A for business of all sizes. Our clientele includes Google, Microsoft, Bloomberg, and many other Fortune 1000 names. Stack Overflow for Teams builds on our proven Q&A approach by providing a private, secure home for your organization’s own Q&A. This gives your technical staff instant access to their peers’ expert knowledge of your own proprietary systems and processes—in the same format they already use to get general coding help. We’re a profitable and fast growing organization looking for talented, self-directed individuals who combine technical know-how with excellent writing abilities. 

Stack Overflow is seeking an experienced Technical Evangelist to support our Sales Team. The Technical Evangelist will have a deep understanding of our new offerings and product roadmaps. You will work hand-in-hand with the Sales Team to identify and qualify business opportunities, willing to travel to client's offices, identify key customer technical objections, and help develop strategies to resolve technical impediments.

  • At least 6 years of experience in architecting or designing software solutions for customers
  • Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with multiple technological environments
  • Ability to demonstrate strong written, oral and presentation skills with the ability to discuss highly technical concepts to all audiences

Preferred qualifications:

items.content:
About WBECS

Imagine being a key part of the team behind the world’s largest online event for professional

Coaches. The World Business & Executive Coach Summit (WBECS) takes place every year and is

highly regarded by coaching professionals worldwide.

You’d be working with those who coach the elite of the business world - names like Richard

Branson, Steve Jobs, and Elon Musk. Development experts who guide companies like NASA and

World Bank to greatness - those are the coaches we work with personally to help get their amazing

thought leadership out to the world.

Due to our fast growth, we are looking for an exceptional new Copywriter to join us.

We run the largest online event for coaches (www.wbecs.com) with 50 of the top thought leaders

for the coaching industry, and in addition to this, we also launch individual programmes such as

Narrative Coach and Conversational Intelligence for Coaches. We also have a philanthropic mission,

which takes the form of EthicalCoach (www.ethicalcoach.org).

W O R L D B U S I N E S S A N D E X E C U T I V E C O A C H S U M M I T G R O U P

Copywriter

Our Mission and our Culture

Our mission at WBECS is to raise the global standard of coaching by providing executive coaches

with the highest quality content available in the industry. WBECS is a growing remote global

workforce, we are truly passionate about our people!

This is not your typical office job. Our passionately-engaged, global team works 100% remotely and

collaborates vigorously. The lifestyle design is flexible but full on; and the culture is fast-paced. We

consider our work our “art”, striving for excellence in everything we do. "We consider ourselves as

family and here's an inside look at some of the family fun." The lifestyle design is flexible, but full

on and the culture is fast-paced. We consider our work our “art” and strive for excellence in

everything we do.

Our Programs

Adjacent to the annual Summit event, WBECS runs a number of learning programs in collaboration

with some of the coaching industry’s most respected and revered principle players:

• Coach Master Toolkit© (CMT) with Andrew Neitlich

• Narrative Coach (NC) with Dr. David Drake

• Conversational Intelligence® for Coaches (C-IQ) with the late, great Judith E. Glaser

• Coaching with Return on Investment (ROI) with Lisa Ann Edwards

• EthicalCoach (EC) - our non-profit initiative with a team including Marshall Goldsmith

Each of these programs/projects has its own, subtly-nuanced tone of voice, which, as our new

Copywriter, you would have to learn to adapt and adhere to.

Our Tone of Voice

The tone we wish to strike with our coaching community is warm, friendly and inviting. We pride

ourselves on not patronizing our audience. Our copy is designed to make the coach the star - not

ourselves. Sentences are concise - we try not to string too many thoughts together at once to

illustrate our clear intent and the benefits they will enjoy. The content we write talks to our coaches

- not at them. This creates a sense of intelligent, educated people in conversation with one another.

An overview of working for us

Our busiest times are always when we are about to launch a new program or event. A lot of materials

need to be written and prepared weeks in advance of the launch date. This is when you will find

your ‘To Do’ list runs pretty high. For example, for the relaunch of Narrative Coach in early 2019, a

total of 163 emails needed to be drafted. Not to mention accompanying web pages, social media

posts, blog posts and so on - and that is just one program. As well as our existing programs and

events, we are also piloting and planning to launch new ones too.

We will ask you to work hard, fast and to the best of your ability. As long as you are fully prepared

to do that, you will find working for WBECS very rewarding. Perks far outweigh the pitfalls. We

gather together once a year for our annual Company Retreat, giving you the opportunity to travel to

some spectacular locations. We offer the flexibility of remote working, to become a part of a

diverse, global team, and a competitive salary.

Summary of the Copywriter Role

Working closely with the Marketing Director and Lead Copywriter, you’ll be a master wordsmith

responsible for creating engaging copy for web pages, emails, social media and other marketing

materials across our full range of programs. Fast-paced work with quick turnarounds, you’ll be

flexible, creative and innovative.

The Ideal candidate will be able to work as part of a diverse team. They will be confident, with

excellent communication skills and a keen grasp on the written word. Copywriting experience is

essential. The ability to edit and proofread both their own work and the work of others is also highly

desirable.

Responsibilities

• Write clear and attractive content that reflects our brand’s voice, and that converts traffic at

a high rate

• Collaborate with the Marketing Team to develop a variety of content marketing materials

• Produce error-free content that adheres to the company’s style guidelines and captures our

audience

• Interpret creative direction and briefs into persuasive copy concepts

• Edit and proofread copy as needed

• Use SEO principles to maximize the reach of our copy

• Simultaneously manage work across multiple projects with various deadlines

• Propose copy concepts and present underlying strategic thinking to the Marketing Director

NB: The above list of duties is not exclusive or exhaustive, and the post holder will be required to

undertake any such tasks as may be reasonably expected.

Qualifications

• Love what they do, and have fun doing it!

• Have a background in producing copy for digital channels including direct-response

• Understand SEO concepts, and how to best produce copy achieve SEO goals

• Possess a keen eye for detail - experience in writing direct-response copy

• Able to stay up-to-date on the latest sales psychology

• Have knowledge/understanding of Slack, Gmail, Google Drive, HRIS and Asana

Other Requirements

• Fluent in English

• Strong Internet connection

• Punctual and reliable

• Team Player

• Flexibility to work with multiple time zones

Perks, Benefits, and Compensation

• Competitive Salary

• Annual All-Team Retreat

• Opportunities to travel

• The flexibility of working remotely from home

If you think this sounds like you and are interested in applying for the role,

Please send:

1. A cover letter explaining why you are an excellent fit for this role and this epic team

2. Your resume to Colleen@wbecs.com with the subject line: Copywriter

Note:

Applicants who do not submit a cover letter with their application will not be considered.

This position is 100% remote as we are a global team! Primary working hours are US Eastern

Time-based and will require flexible hours during program launches.

We will be setting up interviews immediately. Thank you!

items.title: Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese
items.content:
Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese

Company: Legalcom Group
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance

Description

We’re looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about a wide range of topics, including legal topics.

Most of our work is on legal topics. All topics related to legal are entry-level and not at an academic level.

You’ll be writing about everything from why a certain legal contract is required for a business to writing a checklist article of best tools to use for an e-commerce store to increase sales.

 

About The Work

We understand the value of quality content. We’re not looking for plain text articles, but well-researched articles to educate our customers: articles with images, links, quotes from research papers, expert’s quotes etc.

Our articles are often 1000+ words, generally around 2,000 words. Some articles are beyond 10,000 words.

We’re not looking to game search engines, but rather educate our customers about the legal contracts they’re searching for. We aim to be a teacher to our customers.

We are looking for writers available for a minimum of one day/week. We have as much work as you can handle. We don’t micromanage.

We are very clear on what we want for every article. We provide topics with a proposed structure including due dates and the minimum required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth during the revision session. But for the most part: you write the article, turn it in, we review and ask for edits if necessary and then publish it.

Writers get paid every other week, in US dollars by PayPal.

Depending on where we’ll publish your work, and for as much as we can, we’ll show your bio byline to give you author credits.

 

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have English Proficiency qualification.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well-organized and reliable
  • Some degree of technical proficiency (Google Docs, taking screenshots)

It’s a major plus if you have any of the following:

  • Legal degree or paralegal experience

 

How Do We Work?

We work remotely. We don’t need to sync time zones.

We work over Google Docs and email.

 

How To Apply?

Please send an email to [email protected] with:

  • A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit
  • 3 URLs showcasing your work related to internet laws or technology
  • Your freelance writing rates (per word, please!)

Please format your subject line as follows: Your Name | Freelance Writer | ProBlogger (example: John Doe | Freelance Writer | ProBlogger). The subject line format is important, otherwise our editor won’t get your email.

We look forward to hearing from you!

items.content:
Content Writer within Business, Startups, Marketing & Productivity [ Long-term position ]

Company: SquidHub
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract

Description

Do you want to write short pieces of content (educational, book reviews, tips, etc.) within business, sales, marketing and start-ups? And do you want to have a steady flow of work sent your way? Then this could very well be for you.

We are looking for an exceptional writer that is able to do in-depth research and write content within the area of marketing, sales, business and start-ups. The audience is primarily small business owners, founders and people working in startups, that want to get inspired and learn new skills that they can apply to the work they do in their business on a daily basis.

Most of the content pieces will also be turned into podcasts or videos and the style of writing should therefore be light and conversational, but also be to-the-point and deliver value to the audience.

Example of topics could be:

"Is the 4-hour work week still relevant in 2019?" [Book review]

"What is the optimal process for hiring an administrative assistant" [Educational]

"5 tools to improve your productivity in 2019" [Tips & tricks]

About the work

We focus on quality content, meaning well-researched content pieces.

The articles, depending on the topic, will be around 1000-1800 words. We are looking to have 1-3 pieces done every week.

We will provide you with specific topics, but as we get more familiar with each other, you could potentially also start choosing topics yourself.

We expect the working style to be the following: We agree on the topic, you write the first draft including the sources you have used in your research, we review it and, in most cases, do the finishing touches ourselves.

We will pay after every content piece, preferably through PayPal. Other payment methods and timing can be discussed.

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker (preferably US/CAN) with strong writing skills and ability to write in a way that allows us to convert the piece into other formats such as voice or video. We can make an exception on this requirement depending on your qualifications.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well-organized and reliable
  • It’s a major plus if you are interested in business strategy, start-ups, productivity, marketing, etc.

How do we work?

We are located in Denmark, but have many remote freelancers working for us across the globe. You can therefore work remotely and when it suits you. Our communication is usually over email.

How to apply?

Please send an email to [email protected] with:

  • A couple of sentences introduction you, where you are located, what you do for a living in case you are not a full-time writer and explaining why you think you would be a good fit.
  • 2-3 URLs showcasing your work related to a business topic preferably showcasing a lighter more conversational style or scripts for videos or podcasts.
  • Your rates, preferably per word.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

items.content:
Writer – Home and Technology at Red Ventures

Remote | Freelance

Remote

(The ideal candidate for this role can work remotely)

Red Ventures is looking for freelance writers to write engaging, consumer-friendly content for a variety of digital brands. If you’re a versatile writer with experience (or interest) writing for home products, services or technology – this is the role for you!

The ideal writer can do thorough research, cut through technical jargon and simplify complex topics for the average reader. You’ll write articles, product pages, guides, reviews, general news and white papers. Most content assignments are pre-determined with specific guidelines to make the work easy – but we’re always looking for great ideas.

What we offer freelance writers:

  • Consistent, flat per piece rates.
  • A steady stream of work with new assignments released regularly weekly.
  • Detailed project outlines and clear guidelines.
  • A monthly payment cycle.
  • The ability to work on your own terms. As long as you meet deadlines, you can write from anywhere.

Responsibilities

  • Write for a variety of topics including internet, home security, home technology, home maintenance, repair and local services.
  • Write a minimum of 5,000 words per week (or 3-5 pieces)
  • Deliver quality content that is easy to read.
  • Research topics and properly source references.
  • Proofread: Turn in clean work that doesn’t need heavy editing.
  • Take feedback well. View edits as a way to improve your craft.
  • Follow detailed project specifications, outlines, length requirements and content style guidelines.

Qualifications:

  • You must have at least two years of writing or reporting experience.
  • You have work samples that show high quality writing with demonstrated understanding of grammar, AP style and basic web writing/SEO best practices.
  • You must have a Gmail account (or be able to make one).

How to apply:

  1. Submit your resume
  2. Include at least two writing samples, or a link to an online portfolio with examples of your writing. If you don’t have enough recent writing samples, we’ll ask you to complete a writing test.

If your resume and work fits our profile, you will receive information about our rates.

Apply for job

Managing Content Editor at School of Motion

Remote

Our Managing Content Editor will be responsible for onboarding, managing, and developing our team of content contributors. You will be responsible for organizing and overseeing the creation of articles, tutorials, and podcasts for School of Motion. As such, much of your day will be spent overseeing content creation from both in-house and outside contributors.

Your Day to Day will include:

  • Editing Copy
  • Managing a network of content contributors and freelancers
  • Helping to set and stick to realistic deadlines for all content pieces
  • Wrangling all deliverables
  • Making sure that all delivery specs are up to standards
  • All the producer-y stuff

As a Content Editor for School of Motion you will also be tasked with editing great Motion Design content, articles, emails, pages, and more. This is a job for a serious grammar nerd. As a Content Editor you will edit written content across School of Motion’s ecosystem including:

  • Articles
  • Emails
  • Landing Pages
  • FAQs Pages
  • eBooks
  • PDFs
  • Internal Documentation
  • Sales Materials

Our content covers many Motion Design topics, from After Effects and Cinema 4D to landing pages and support macros. As such, ideal candidates should be comfortable with editing highly technical content in a collaborative environment. You don’t have to be a professional motion designer, but you do need to edit and collaborate on content written about motion design.

As a Content Editor your time will be spent polishing our public-facing content. Your attention to detail will help School of Motion achieve our content objectives and deliver a highly-curated educational experience. You will directly report to our Marketing Manager.

As a Managing Content Editor will work with our network of contributors and in-house writers to see articles, tutorials, and podcasts through to completion. You will be tasked with working with our contributors to outline, critique, and edit content from idea to publication.

We are looking for a detail oriented person who can see assigned tasks through to completion. You should have experience editing online content and giving feedback to others on both written and video content.

We always have new and exciting projects to work on, and you’ll be in the middle of it all. This is your chance to make a difference in the world’s most exciting industry.

Required Skills:

  • 2-3 Years Editing Experience
  • At least 2 Years of Project Management Experience
  • A Love of Writing
  • Strong Time-Management Skills

Bonus Skills:

  • Familiarity with Photoshop and Indesign
  • Familiarity with Motion Design and Graphic Design
  • Video Production/Editing Experience

Good Luck!

SOM

Application Requirements

  1. Resume
  2. Cover letter which includes your favorite life hack
  3. Link to your online author page / portfolio
  4. A writing sample

About School of Motion

At School of Motion we’re trying to reinvent the way students learn online by combining the best parts of a traditional brick-and-mortar school with technology that allows our students to receive the elite Motion Design training from anywhere in the world. Our mission is to break down the barriers to learning, mastering, and working in Motion Design. We currently have ten comprehensive courses, over 5,000 Alumni, dozens of Teaching Assistants, and a small team of full-time staff working diligently to keep everything running! And this is only the beginning…

Our Core Values:

Our core values embody our team dynamic and our voice. We are rebellious, helpful, effective, playful, and curious. If you would like to work with us, you should be all of these things too:

  • Rebellious
    • We don’t like to do things just because they’ve always been done that way. Be skeptical of the status quo and constantly improve.
  • Helpful
    • There is no such thing as “not my job”. Help out in any way you can, and don’t hesitate to reach out for help.
  • Effective
    • We do things fast and smart. We automate if it makes sense. We skip the meeting if its not immediately beneficial to the mission.
  • Playful
    • No Bad Vibes. Don’t take yourself too seriously, it’s only Animation.
  • Curious
    • Have interests, pursue them ruthlessly. Share your weirdness.

Some important information…

While School of Motion does not discriminate on the basis of citizenship or national origin, we may only employ United States citizens and people who are authorized to work in the United States. As long as you meet that criteria, you can work from wherever that is comfortable for you! We’re a fully remote team that primarily operates on Eastern Standard Time, and if you are local to Sarasota, Providence, or Los Angeles then you can come work with us in person.

Salary Range

Salary starting at $50,000 and may be higher depending on your experience and fit for the role.

We have some great benefits!

  • We cover 100% of your health insurance and a portion for your spouse and children
  • We have an extremely flexible time off policy. Work wherever you want with an internet connection.
  • Access to a 401K plan after one year of employment
  • Profit based bonus program
  • Saying that we have a very casual work environment is an understatement, just be you.
  • An exceptional giphy game.

The position does require domestic travel at least twice per year when we all get together for company retreats and industry conferences (they are fun!).

School of Motion is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind.

School of Motion is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at School of Motion are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate

Description

We create high-level copy for some of the largest ecommerce companies around the world, and we're currently seeking experienced freelance writers and editors.

We currently have three projects for which we're hiring:

Electronics and Tech: these projects consist of writing and editing 150 to 500-word product descriptions and landing page copy for a major electronics retailer. This retailer specializes in computers, cameras and all related equipment, but they also sell televisions, speakers, media players, gaming consoles, telescopes, audio/video equipment, and other tech-related products. While you don't need to be a "geek" to make this work, it would probably help. Otherwise, bring your A-game when it comes to research!

Packaging: this project consists of writing and editing 300-word landing page copy for a B2B packaging company. We'll be writing for enterprise-level customers, with our client selling bottles, jars, and other product packaging. While you don't have to be in the industry to do this work, experience with ecommerce writing and solid researching skills will help!

Tools and Home Improvement: this project consists of writing and editing 60-100, 125-150, or 300-400 words of content for a short category pages, long category pages, and product descriptions. Copy will focus on home improvement products and categories, such as tools, appliances, lighting, hardware, gardening, and more.

What's a landing page? It's a webpage that showcases a particular category of products, such as camera lens covers, Playstation 4 games, or mason jars. Our job is to write copy that will help shoppers learn about the products: what they are, the important features and/or benefits, what they need to know when making a purchase, etc.

What's a product description? It's website copy that describes a specific product. It's generally broken up into paragraph copy and 3-5 bullets. Its purpose is to introduce a shopper to the product's particular features and benefits. Unlike category page content that might focus on amber glass jars in general, a product description will focus on a specific product, such as a 4-ounce straight-sided amber glass jar.

We have a full style guides available that explains everything more clearly and can answer any questions you have, so don't worry if you're unsure or confused about what we're looking for.

We need people who:

-- Are fluent in English as their first language

-- Have experience writing and/or editing ecommerce copy (SEO experience a plus!)

-- Can follow instructions

-- Can positively accept and apply feedback

-- Can stick to deadlines

-- Will only submit unique content

-- Can and are willing to do research when required

-- Can accept payment via PayPal on a weekly basis

If you have the time and ability to help, please reach out ASAP. We have work available NOW and need immediate help. This is a freelance position, but we have plenty to keep you busy. Pay varies per project and role, but writing projects are in the range of 3 to 5 cents per word.

You’ll collaborate with our engineers, who typically write the first draft of docs for the new features they create. You’ll be at the leading edge of DevOps and remote work while contributing to one of the world’s largest open-source projects and engaging with our wider community.

GitLab is an all-remote company, and this is a remote position with no geographical requirements. You will be part of a fast-growing team with members in North America, Europe, and Australia.

Responsibilities

  • Continuously improve GitLab’s documentation content in collaboration with engineers, product managers, and others.
    • Review and edit doc plans and content for all new and enhanced features.
    • Through the use and testing of GitLab and its documentation, as well as SME interviews, proactively identify information needs and content opportunities. Develop new content to meet those needs and plan further work for the technical writing team.
    • Plan and complete large content initiatives such as section reviews and overhauls.
    • Help developers and other members of the community who have documentation-related questions.
    • Help review and triage incoming suggestions, corrections, and other content from the community.
    • Act as a primary content reviewer for other technical writers.
  • Continuously improve GitLab’s documentation site features and user experience in collaboration with engineers and other technical writers. This may include the documentation site’s design, search, build process, feedback methods, SEO, visitor analytics, versioning, and other technical components.
    • Plan and lead documentation site feature enhancement initiatives.
    • Work with UX to identify contextual content/documentation opportunities in the product.
    • Produce reports on documentation usage and metadata.
  • Contribute to the improvement of team process and style, as well as cross-functional efforts.
    • Act as a reviewer of release blog posts and contributor to GitLab’s Handbook.
    • Make it easy for contributors from the community—internal and external—to submit quality documentation.
    • Contribute to the documentation Style Guide and documentation process guides.
    • Collaborate and improve upon collaborative processes with others including product managers, Support, Marketing, Engineering, and the wider GitLab community.
  • Leadership and collaboration
    • Mentor newly hired technical writers.
    • Lead projects when pairing with other technical writers.
    • Plan new cross-functional efforts.
    • Represent the team at hackathons or other community endeavors.
    • Plan and lead a portion of the team’s process-improvement initiatives.
    • Organize and prioritize portions of the team’s work backlogs.

Requirements

  • You have:
    • Extensive experience planning, writing, and managing software documentation.
    • Excellent skills in writing, editing, research, and planning.
    • Understanding of what makes documentation clear and effective.
    • Great teaching skills that translate into amazing written work.
    • Experience establishing processes used by teams across an organization in support of documentation.
    • Experience planning and leading major initiatives such as the launch of new documentation resources, large-scale documentation reviews and overhauls, cross-functional initiatives, etc.
    • Experience using data and evidenced-based decision making.
    • Experience using Git on the Linux or Mac command line and developer tools and workflows.
    • Experience with a docs-as-code workflow, a markup language such as Markdown, AsciiDoc, or reStructuredText, and at least one programming language (though this does not need to be from a professional context).
  • You are:
    • Highly organized; able to triage and prioritize numerous issues and projects.
    • Able to succeed in a remote, globally distributed work environment.
  • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

You’ll receive special consideration if you have experience with:

  • Developing sites using static site generators.
  • Multiple DevOps tools.
  • JavaScript and intermediate front-end development.
  • Advanced programming or other technical experience.

Our hiring process is described in more detail in our Handbook’s Hiring section. When you apply, please include a cover letter that describes why you are interested in this position and in what ways you are well-qualified for it.

About GitLab

GitLab Inc. is a company based on the GitLab open-source project. GitLab is a community project to which over 1,000 people worldwide have contributed. We are an active participant in this community, trying to serve its needs and lead by example. We have one vision: everyone can contribute to all digital content, and our mission is to change all creative work from read-only to read-write so that everyone can contribute.

We value results, transparency, sharing, freedom, efficiency, frugality, collaboration, directness, kindness, diversity, boring solutions, and quirkiness. If these values match your personality, work ethic, and personal goals, we encourage you to visit our primer to learn more. Open source is our culture, our way of life, our story, and what makes us truly unique.

Top 10 reasons to work for GitLab:

  1. Work with helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people.
  2. Work remote so you have no commute and are free to travel and move.
  3. Have flexible work hours so you are there for other people and free to plan the day how you like.
  4. Everyone works remote, but you don’t feel remote. We don’t have a head office, so you’re not in a satellite office.
  5. Work on open source software so you can interact with a large community and can show your work.
  6. Work on a product you use every day: we drink our own wine.
  7. Work on a product used by lots of people that care about what you do.
  8. As a company we contribute more than we take, most of our work is released as the open source GitLab CE.
  9. Focused on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life and don’t burn out.
  10. Open internal processes: know what you’re getting in to and be assured we’re thoughtful and effective.

items.content:
Dutch-Speaking Marketing Editor and Proofreader at Wonderbly

Remote | International | Part-time

Who are Wonderbly?

Wonderbly is a unique, award-winning start-up that lives on the intersection of storytelling, engineering, digital and print. We are building a global personal-publishing business that brings millions of people into our products – as co-creators and audiences We are best known for our first title, Lost My Name, which is read by over 4 million children and their families globally. We are releasing a new title every few months and now have 18 books in our range.

Our focus in the near future is with the children’s book market – creating stunning, uncompromisingly high quality and technically ambitious personalised books for kids.

We’re in the business of sparking kids’ imaginations; inspiring them to read & to learn as well as build confidence and self-belief. May 2019 sees a relaunch of our website and material to back up that positioning.

About the role

  • 2-4 hours per week
  • Remote – good internet connection required
  • Start ASAP
  • £25/€29 per hour

Wonderbly is looking for wonderful Dutch-speaking editors/proof-readers, who can work closely with our copywriters to ensure the highest standard content for our international markets.

It’s our editor’s job to ensure that the copy we use across all our comms to customers is on brand, appropriately localised and free of errors.

It’s a chance to help to create humorous, lively and all-around-fun copy for a company that is dedicated to making children more clever, curious and kind (and making them laugh, too).

What you will do

The role is to edit/proof-read content written by our marketing copywriters. The proofing is to ensure there are no errors in the copy but also to feedback on the quality and content of what is written.

Whilst our copywriters generally retain the final call on what is written, our editors offer support in ideas on how to improve the copy and ensure that it is suitable for the audience in that particular market.

We expect our copywriters and editors to work in quite a collaborative way but are flexible in what this means for each language team.

All of the content is for marketing, brand and editorial purposes across our website and digital marketing channels. Therefore having an editor with experience working with e-commerce brands and with an understanding of paid marketing channels such as Facebook and PPC is a huge benefit.

In addition to this, our editors should, of course, know their market extremely well – preferably from the view point of digital marketing.
The three main kinds of content that you’ll be working on are…

  • Website
    • As an e-commerce company, our website is our shop and needs to communicate who we are and what we do. Our tone of voice is important to us, and should be consistently upheld across the website.
    • At the same time, each locale should have a tailor fit approach to give our customers the best possible experience, no matter where they live. In addition, the purchase journey should be as smooth as possible – enabling customers to make a pain free purchase and leave them wanting to come back again and again!
  • Paid marketing + Email
    • We tell our audiences about our books across performance marketing channels such as Facebook and PPC/Google Search. The ideal candidate would have experience editing for a similar brand across digital marketing platforms – and have knowledge of the markets in order to successfully cover relevant keywords and messaging, as well as bringing ideas for fresh content. In addition, we regularly communicate with our customers via email to let them know about product releases, editorial blog content and our trade events. The tone across all of these needs to remain consistent and on brand – written to entice and entertain our existing customers.
  • Trade Events
    • Alongside launching new products, one of our biggest areas of new copy each month is for trade events. These are one-off campaigns we run around a specific theme, for example, World Book Day or Summer Reading. These events usually mean a promotion that is run onsite and via email. We update the website to revolve around this theme so we have updates to copy on the website, email and across social media.
  • Editorial content
    • Finally, we also like to regularly post longer form editorial blog content such as craft activities or listicle posts which summarise the uniqueness of our products. This content aims to engage our audience and is a softer approach to increasing brand awareness – so calls for a slightly different style and tone.

* This is not an exhaustive list of the content that may require editing but summarises the main areas of copy

Requirements

  • Minimum 4 years mid-level experience in the specified language
  • Demonstrable skills editing or writing across all digital media – including Facebook ads and social media posts, blog entries etc.
  • Experience writing or editing content for the children’s gift/book market an advantage
  • Whilst not necessary an understanding of what parents are looking for – potentially a parent, aunt/uncle, grandparent!
  • Flexibility with part-time work and able to work remotely (so a good internet connection is essential)
  • A good team worker and happy to communicate mostly via email and occasional video calls

GET PAID TO WRITE ROMANCE | LONG-TERM WORK | HIRING NOW

Company: HotGhostWriter Ltd.
Location: Work Remotely
Job Type: Contract

Description

Are you looking to earn a consistent income writing high-quality novels in your favorite Romance subgenres and themes?

Then this could well be your next paid writing gig!

 

Job Overview

We are currently looking to expand our fiction team with amazing and experienced romance writers (based in the US or Canada) in all romance subgenres. We are a fast-paced, growing ghostwriting service that can provide you with consistent and exciting projects week after week! Regardless of your romance subgenre preferences, we may have a job for you.

If you are someone that takes pride in their work and is looking to earn a consistent income doing something you enjoy, working from the comfort of your home or office, and doing so alongside an excited and brilliant team, then you may just fit our criteria and land yourself an exciting new gig with us.

 

The Company

As a company, our brand is synonymous with the highest quality writing and great customer experience. Our online reviews are a testament to that. We are thrilled about this and continue to strive for more.

However, our focus is not just on our clients, but also on the team that makes it happen. We love our team and focus on creating an enjoyable working process and keeping their pipelines full with great projects, bringing them a steady income.

In return, our writers ensure that every client that walks through our virtual doors receives an outstanding experience and walks away happy with their product. As a collective, we are always looking to improve and this as allowed our company to grow.

We also focus on helping our writers grow- we do this via a number of development programs we run such as our book club, mastermind groups, editor feedback, writing discussions, and more. This ensures that every writer that passes through HotGhostWriter grows and takes their craft to a higher level. Keep reading if this resonates with you.

 

Pay Rate

Our current rate is $15 USD per 1,000 words. Our projects range from 20k up to 150k words.

Some of our busier writers are earning $2,000+ a month writing a few hours a day around their studies or other gigs. We offer consistent work without having to apply for jobs, work comes to you. Plus, you'll love the team and process!

 

Our Requirements

We are looking for romance writers with at least a good basic skill level and a good understanding of the conventions of the romance subgenre as a whole, and of your preferred romance themes. Here's what's required to be part of our team:

- You write amazing romance stories. With a lot of tension, suspense, great dialogue, and good character development and characterization.
- You are US/CAN based, or US/CAN citizen living outside the country.
- You can work with deadlines. We typically deliver 15k words in 1 week/ week and a half.
- You are knowledgeable in your preferred romance subgenres, themes/tropes. You understand the readers, you understand basic conventions that make a subgenre/theme/etc and you can write to market.
- You take pride in your writing and can consistently deliver high-quality novels. You focus on delivering what the reader and client want.
- You are looking for a long-term gig and are eager & available to start.
- You are available throughout the day to respond to team and client messages on our platform.
- You are reliable, well-spoken, open to constructive criticism and a good communicator.

 

Few things to consider before applying

Important: When applying you will be asked to select up to 3 of your best subgenres. Choose the subgenres you most enjoy and know most about (conventions, typical characters, etc). Please submit a sample for each subgenre you select. If you are successful, we will hire you for 1, 2 or all 3 of your chosen subgenres based on your ability to write and your understanding of each subgenre's conventions. We put a lot of emphasis on this as it's vital to understand what the reader wants.

We will also prioritize you that can commit for at least 3-6 months. This is because we love to establish long-term relationships with our team and also because our clients love to create a series of projects with the same writer. Once expectations are clear with a client, you can expect awesome projects to keep flowing your way. This requires a basic commitment of 3 months or so.

Also, you must be able to sit down and write in order to meet deadlines. Good planning should make this easier. Again, availability throughout the day to respond to messages on our platform is essential.

Finally, you must be okay with not getting official credit for your writing as this is a ghostwriting position.

 

How To Apply?

So if read what the position entails and you're excited to test your luck and apply? That's amazing and we look forward to getting your application. To apply, click the link below to complete our form where you will have to answer a number of questions and also provide your writing samples. If you're a little reluctant based on your professional experience, don't let that stop you. As long as you have some samples and you understand romance, we'd love to consider you.

 

Application Form

https://airtable.com/shrk4Ug4RngCp1fC3

Please remember to provide at least 1 sample per subgenre you select (Choose no more than 3 subgenres). Each sample must be at least 1,000 words.

We do get numerous applications on a daily basis, so do bear with us and allow us at least 2 weeks to get to your application.

 

Best of luck!

items.title: Write Remotely for Hotels around the World!
items.content:
Write Remotely for Hotels around the World!

Company: Arrivedo
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance

Description

We want to change the way everyone travels. We want travelers to experience the best local insights every time and make the most out of their trip. This is your chance to help us change that.

Arrivedo works with a community of thousands of international freelance writers, (including, but not limited to) travel-oriented bloggers, authors, literature and creative writing students who create Neighborhood Guides for hotels all over the world. We currently host over 20,000 travel articles for hotels in more than 250 cities around the globe, providing our services to independent hotels, boutique hotels, B&Bs, hostels in remote locations, as well as to renowned international chains like Belmond, Loews, GHL, JW Marriott, Waldorf-Astoria and Four Seasons.

What does the Arrivedo Writers Community do?
Help travelers with local recommendations you share in a hotel’s Neighborhood Guide and top content individual articles.

 

What are your opportunities as an Arrivedo Freelancer?

Option 1: Outreaching hotels and crafting their Neighborhood Guides.

1st: Outreach to hotels: Approach hotels via email/calls or in person (what you prefer!) offering to set up their profile and create a guide in Arrivedo. (We provide support, resources, and incentives for contacting those hotels with Arrivedo team for upselling products)

2nd: Gather hotels local recommendations: Interview hotel staff to collect the hotel’s local recommendations and insights into their neighborhood.
3th: Create a Neighborhood Guide: Use Arrivedo’s editor to create 8-10 short articles showcasing the hotel’s local recommendations from themes ranging from routes, gastronomy, nightlife, cultural activities, essential tips and more. Here is an example Neighborhood Guide from Hotel Majestic in Chicago: https://arrivedo.com/dest/en/chicago/hotel/the-majestic-hotel-3.

 

Option 2: Written Assignments  

As an Arrivedo Writer, you can also access to other written assignments.

  • Article Challenge: We want you to help us on creating unique articles with Extraordinary Content around different social and cultural trends, top travel destinations and travel niches, while also being in charge of distributing that content through our community and your network.
  • Other Content Tasks: We also have specific cases when we need content or translations for specific locations or events.

 

Option 3: Be part of our staff

After some time getting experience with us, writers of our community can become testers of new product releases, editors and/or publishers. We even facilitate opportunities for other travel freelance skills like photography, design, web development, and more.

 

What are the benefits?

  • Be part of a freelance community for travel multi-skilled professionals and access multiple opportunities.
  • Getting certified as one of Arrivedo’s thousands of international travel freelance writers.
  • Being able to sell your writing services to any hotel in the world. Arrivedo does not take a commission from your deals with hotels. Transactions are 1-on-1 in between writers and hotels.
  • Improve your sales skills. We will provide you training, materials, webinars, as well as personalized support to help you on the outreach process.
  • Be aware that hotels prefer to pay with free accommodation (normally 3 nights), but you can negotiate a monetary payment.

Freelance Content Copywriter and Blogging Badass

Company: FATJOE
Location: United Kingdom
Job Type: Freelance

Description

HEY, WE’RE FATJOE. ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR REMARKABLE COPYWRITING TEAM?

Our remarkable copywriters are at the core of what we do and we’re extremely proud of each and every one of them. We take the time to get to know everyone personally, find out what you like, what you don’t like, what your hobbies are and what your favourite movie is. Importantly you’ll get the freedom of working anywhere in the world during your own hours. We have a dedicated Content Manager who’ll be your point of contact for all things FATJOE should you ever hit a stumbling block - or if you just fancy a chat!

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING AS A COPYWRITER.

As a copywriter, you can expect to be assigned writing projects from a variety of different niches. Alongside writing for our flagship Blogger Outreach service you can also expect to work on web page content, product/service reviews, articles, etc… Importantly you’ll have the flexibility of completing these and letting your creative juices flow during your own hours allowing you to control the perfect work/life balance for you. You’ll get praise and recognition for when you particularly excel. Even though we work remotely you can expect really close communication and collaboration via phone, email, and Skype with our support team and other writers. We’re here when you need us and we hope you’re there when we need you.

We offer consistent workloads, so there’ll be no more guessing about your workload. Once we agree on a daily allocation you can rest easy knowing you’ll get that work day in, day out. This consistency means you can instead focus on what matters - the writing.

THE TYPE OF PERSON WE’RE LOOKING FOR.

Ideally, you’ll have previous writing experience in a similar environment as part of a company or as a freelancer. FATJOE writers need a flair for research and no fear of the niche. You’ll need to be available daily so we can communicate projects with you. We expect work to be delivered in a timely manner however you will get plenty of notice and still have the freedom to work the hours you want.

5 REASONS TO JOIN OUR TALENTED WRITING TEAM.

  • Our world-beating team. We hire based on talent, and you’ll be joining our scrappy cohort to take on the world. Whether you need some guidance with your writing or just fancy a chat, our team will be on hand to help you out.
  • Choose your own working hours. As long as you’re available daily you can complete projects at your own pace in your own time. We’ll expect you to meet reasonable deadlines but with plenty of notice. Want that regular working week? Sign-up Mon-Fri. Fancy some weekday flexibility? Sign-up Thurs-Mon.
  • No need to contact the clients. We handle all of that. All you need to do is complete your projects - we take care of everything else. We know you want to be focussing on your writing, and the hassle of clients just gets in the way.
  • Quick and easy payments. We make payments every week like clockwork. There’s no need to wait weeks, chasing clients day-after-day. KEEN? WE THOUGHT YOU WOULD BE.

Please note at this time we can only accept writers who are based in the UK!

Content Writer for Health-Tech Startup [Long-term position]

Company: Rehaler
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract

Description

Do you want to help write content that will make the lives better for millions of people suffering from migraine?

We are looking for an exceptional content writer that is able to take complex health topics related to migraine, medicine, biology and neuroscience, and turn them into content pieces that are both enlightening, valuable, as well easy and enjoyable to read.

Our target audience is migraine patients and the style of writing should reflect that. We want to both educate and inform but also give them actionable advice for dealing with their migraine.

Example of topics could be:

"Why can warm, humid weather trigger a migraine attack?"

"What is the long-term effect of migraine on your brain"

"What should you do when diagnosed with migraine?"

About the work

We focus on quality content, meaning well-researched articles with images, links, etc.

We have designers helping us create illustrations for each content piece. These illustrations will be based on image suggestions often supplied by you from when you are researching and writing the piece.

The articles, depending on the topic, will be around 2500-5000 words. We are looking to have one article done every week or every 2nd week.

We will both provide you with specific topics, but as you get more familiar with the topic, you can also choose topics yourself if interested.

Each content piece will have some communication back and forth. The normal style would be the following: We agree on the topic, you write the first draft, we review it and ask for certain edits and you would then finish it.

We will pay after every content piece, preferably through PayPal. Other payment methods and timing can be discussed.

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this requirement depending on your qualifications.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well-organized and reliable
  • It’s a plus if you have an understanding and interest in biology, neuroscience, etc.

How do we work?

We are located in Copenhagen in Denmark, but have many remote freelancers working for us across the globe. You can therefore work remotely and when it suits you. Our communication is usually over email, Google Docs and Slack.

How to apply?

Please send an email to [email protected] with:

  • A couple of sentences introduction you and explaining why you think you would be a good fit
  • 2-3 URLs showcasing your work related to a health or biology topic. Preferably showcasing that you can take a complex topic and make it understandable and an enjoyment to read
  • Your rates, preferably per word
We look forward to hearing from you!

items.content:
Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese

Company: Legalcom Group
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance

Description

We’re looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about a wide range of topics, including legal topics.

Most of our work is on legal topics. All topics related to legal are entry-level and not at an academic level.

You’ll be writing about everything from why a certain legal contract is required for a business to writing a checklist article of best tools to use for an e-commerce store to increase sales.

 

About The Work

We understand the value of quality content. We’re not looking for plain text articles, but well-researched articles to educate our customers: articles with images, links, quotes from research papers, expert’s quotes etc.

Our articles are often 1000+ words, generally around 2,000 words. Some articles are beyond 10,000 words.

We’re not looking to game search engines, but rather educate our customers about the legal contracts they’re searching for. We aim to be a teacher to our customers.

We are looking for writers available for a minimum of one day/week. We have as much work as you can handle. We don’t micromanage.

We are very clear on what we want for every article. We provide topics with a proposed structure including due dates and the minimum required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth during the revision session. But for the most part: you write the article, turn it in, we review and ask for edits if necessary and then publish it.

Writers get paid every other week, in US dollars by PayPal.

Depending on where we’ll publish your work, and for as much as we can, we’ll show your bio byline to give you author credits.

 

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have English Proficiency qualification.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well-organized and reliable
  • Some degree of technical proficiency (Google Docs, taking screenshots)

It’s a major plus if you have any of the following:

  • Legal degree or paralegal experience

 

How Do We Work?

We work remotely. We don’t need to sync time zones.

We work over Google Docs and email.

 

How To Apply?

Please send an email to [email protected] with:

  • A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit
  • 3 URLs showcasing your work related to internet laws or technology
  • Your freelance writing rates (per word, please!)

Please format your subject line as follows: Your Name | Freelance Writer | ProBlogger (example: John Doe | Freelance Writer | ProBlogger). The subject line format is important, otherwise our editor won’t get your email.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Description

Do you have a passion for online marketing that goes above and beyond? Do you enjoy working with cutting edge online tools and providing in-depth insight into different marketing techniques.

This isn’t just another bland online marketing website talking about the same old topics which have been done to death. This site will be in the trenches testing cutting edge software, reviewing popular strategies and theories and helping people become the masters of online marketing.

The site is overseen by a highly skilled and experienced team of online marketers who truly understand the ins and outs of online marketing. Make no mistake, this is no pet project - we are fully fledged, well established business with a loyal fan base. So what exactly do we expect from you?

As a writer, it will be your job to research and investigate software, provide in-depth analysis and come up with conclusive decision making commentary. On occasion, we will also expect you to produce high quality visual content such as screencasts, videos  and screenshots to further illustrate your work, all of which will be discussed in detail with the wider team.

We expect you to have an active input on the website and share your ideas with the team on how we can improve certain processes. This is your chance to leave your unique stamp on the site.

Outcomes:

  • Full fledged and ever growing content will be produced from the ground up
  • Editorial quality standards are consistently exceeded
  • Accompanying videos are recorded and published where appropriate
  • Writing systems and processes are continually improved
  • Minimal spelling and grammar (AP style based) corrections are required
  • Software is fully tested and conclusive opinions are made based on personal experience

 

Competencies:

  • A strong understanding of how to create exceptional content
  • Experience using and/or testing day-to-day marketing software
  • An understanding of marketing concepts and familiarity with testing marketing tools
  • Attention to detail
  • Exceptional English language ability with impeccable written English
  • Willingness to go beyond a simple writer role and share thoughts and opinions on the website as a whole
  • Strong research skills
  • A thorough understanding of the world of online marketing
  • A sense of ownership and responsibility
  • Ability to work across virtual teams
  • The ability to continually improve quality and systems

Benefits:

  • Work with an extremely high performing team
  • Access to our training, resources and network
  • Competitive salary
  • A chance to analyse and work with a wide range of  cutting edge software for free, provided by us
  • Be part of a highly regarded marketing team

This is a long-term role and you will be paid promptly per approved word.

Company: eZdia Inc
Location: Work from home - anywhere

Description

We create high-level copy for some of the largest ecommerce companies around the world, and we're currently seeking experienced freelance writers and editors.

We have an immediate need for writers and editors for our B2B Packaging projects:

Project 1 consists of writing and/or editing 300-word landing page copy.

Project 2 consists of writing and/or editing 150-word product descriptions.

For both projects, we'll be writing for enterprise-level customers, with our client selling bottles, jars, and other product packaging. While you don't have to be in the industry to do this work, experience with ecommerce writing and solid researching skills will help!

What's a landing page? It's a webpage that showcases a particular category of products; for this project, it would be things like mason jars, amber glass bottles, or childproof pharmaceutical packaging. Our job is to write copy that will appear at the top of bottom of the page to help shoppers learn about the products: what they are, general features and/or benefits, what they need to know when making a purchase, etc.

What's a product description? It's website copy that describes a specific product. It's generally broken up into paragraph copy and 3-5 bullets. Its purpose is to introduce a shopper to the product's particular features and benefits. Unlike category page content that might focus on amber glass jars in general, a product description will focus on a specific product, such as a 4-ounce straight-sided amber glass jar.

We have a full style guide available that explains everything more clearly and can answer any questions you have, so don't worry if you're unsure or confused about what we're looking for.

We need people who:

-- Are fluent in English as their first language
-- Have experience writing and/or editing ecommerce copy (SEO experience a plus!)
-- Can follow instructions
-- Can positively accept and apply feedback
-- Can stick to deadlines
-- Will only submit unique content
-- Can and are willing to do research when required
-- Can accept payment via PayPal on a weekly basis

If you have the time and ability to help, please reach out ASAP. We have work available NOW and need immediate help. This is a freelance position, but we have plenty to keep you busy. Pay varies per project and role, but writing projects are in the range of 3 to 5 cents per word.

WordPress Content Writer

Company: Awesome Motive
Location: Fully Remote
Job Type: Full-time

Description

As a Writer at Awesome Motive, you’re responsible for growing our organic traffic and converting website visitors into email subscribers and customers.

To be successful in this role, here’s the type of person you are:

  • You have the ability to research and understand technical concepts and then explain them in simple terms to people who aren’t tech-savvy.
  • You’re confident in accepting critical feedback without taking it personally or arguing.
  • You’re a self-starter who loves taking initiative to solve problems and learn new skills, and are comfortable working with minimal direction.
  • You take pride in the quality and craftsmanship of your work rather than just doing it to get it done.
  • You’re an excellent communicator who makes sure nothing slips through the cracks.
  • You’re passionate about leaving your mark on the web for all to see.
  • You enjoy helping others on your team to succeed.

Here are some skills that are required to be successful this role:

  • IMPORTANT: You have experience writing on WordPress-related topics, such as reviews and/or tutorials, and can share published samples with your application.
  • WordPress: You’re comfortable with writing and formatting posts and pages, changing post status and scheduling posts, installing and configuring plugins, basic WordPress troubleshooting, etc.
  • Writing: You can write a well-structured article with impeccable grammar and spelling in a conversational blog-style tone.
  • Research: You have experience researching online and know how to evaluate the reliability of your sources. You can competently solve your day-to-day problems and satisfy your curiosity with a few Google searches.
  • Image Editing: You can efficiently take screenshots, resize and crop images, compress them, and upload and format images in WordPress so they look good.
  • Basic SEO: You understand what SEO is and why it’s important. You know how to research keyword volume and search intent and how to effectively use keywords in your content without keyword stuffing.
  • Basic HTML: You can use the text editor in WordPress and add links and do basic formatting of lists, subheadings, etc. with HTML.
  • Time Management: You’re able to juggle multiple tasks and projects and prioritize your work effectively to meet all deadlines.
  • Team Player: You enjoy meeting and getting along with people from diverse backgrounds, are respectful of cultural differences and make an effort to communicate clearly. You’re enthusiastic about helping out your teammates.

Here are some bonuses that would be nice to have, but aren’t required:

  • Copywriting: You understand copywriting principles and have experience writing copy that’s proven to convert (like landing pages, sales letters, product descriptions, etc.)
  • Email Marketing: You have proven results writing email copy. You have experience using email marketing software such as Mailchimp or Drip.
  • Google Analytics: You know how to evaluate the effectiveness of your content using Google Analytics.
  • WordPress Development: You have experience in customizing or developing themes or plugins for WordPress.
  • Graphic Design: You have a portfolio of professional-looking web graphics such as blog post featured images, infographics, data visualization, etc.

Responsibilities:

  • Write blog posts that are engaging, useful, actionable, and follow our style guide.
  • See assignments through completion from conception and research to publishing.
  • Make requested edits without expressing frustration or irritation with the editorial process.
  • Do keyword research to identify target keywords and use your research to plan, structure, and write the content.
  • Self-manage and prioritize your workload to keep the blog calendar on schedule with minimal oversight.
  • Monitor SEO rankings and optimize previous posts to rank higher.
  • Work with the developers to write new feature announcements.
  • Write email newsletters and send them using Mailchimp or Drip.
  • Proactively provide creative input in discussions that lead to a higher quality finished product or better idea.
  • Proactively communicate so effectively that other involved team members never wonder what the status is on your activities.

This is not an exhaustive list of role responsibilities. This outline indicates the major responsibilities of this role on a regular basis.

What we offer:

Working for a fast-growing bootstrapped company is a rare opportunity, one we consider a lifestyle choice rather than a job choice. Our positions are challenging, but also come with amazing advantages and fulfillment to those who earn them. Here’s what we offer.

  • Competitive Salary.
  • Health Insurance benefits for full-time U.S. employees.
  • Flexible Schedule – Work from your home. We’re spread out all over the world – United States, Canada, Ukraine, India, Pakistan, and more.
  • We encourage employees to take the time they need for vacation, to stay healthy, and to spend time with friends and family.
  • After one year with the company: 30 calendar days paid maternity/paternity leave, and up to 60 calendar days total time off with position guaranteed.
  • We happily provide or reimburse software you’ll need as well as opportunities that promote continued learning.
  • We give you the opportunity to solve challenging and meaningful problems and make a difference.
  • Custom Branded laptop at your five year anniversary.
  • We cover all costs of company travel (including our annual all-company retreat and mini-team meetups).
  • Ability to work with some of the best people in the business through frequent, if not daily, interactions.
  • And in case you were wondering: no politics, no b.s., and no jerks.

How to apply?

If all of this sounds interesting, then please submit your application here: https://awesomemotive.com/career/wordpress-content-writer/
